SENT.plain: We report the case of a patient with an acute cytomegalovirus (CMV) infection who developed Hughes syndrome, manifested by a common iliac vein thrombosis
IgM anticardiolipin antibodies (aCL) appeared with the onset of the infection, followed later by IgG aCL
Five months later, both IgM and IgG aCL levels disappeared from the serum
This is the second case of Hughes syndrome associated with CMV infection to be reported in the literature
